title: Mage Fortune
body:
{{item:3146}} {{champion:21}} {{item:3146}} 

TL;DR: Add a reasonable AP scaling to MF's W to buff Mage Fortune without affecting the balance of AD Miss Fortune.

AP Miss Fortune is viable. I play her in Platinum and have climbed to where I am now with her, in my promos to Diamond. If there was a small quality of life buff to her she could even be competitive! 

The problem with her currently is that her W scales off of AD and does magic damage while her R scales off of AP and does physical damage. Late game this means your ult doesn't scale well with MPen because the W magic damage is minimal.

If her W were to scale off of AP also, it would not affect the balance of AD MF, but would give AP MF some much needed magic damage.

replies.body:
They killed AP Tristana, AP Yi, AD TF, AP Sion, everything-that-isn't-support Alistar, etc....

I don't think they will ever care about off-builds unfortunately. In fact, I believe they are strongly against off-builds and will do everything in their power to remove the existence of them.

> [{quoted}](name=LifeCyclesTWA,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=36xpxp2h,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-05-11T19:49:15.389+0000)
>
> They killed AP Tristana, AP Yi, AD TF, AP Sion, everything-that-isn't-support Alistar, etc....
> 
> I don't think they will ever care about off-builds unfortunately. In fact, I believe they are strongly against off-builds and will do everything in their power to remove the existence of them.

I mean, most of those were just extremely unfun to play against, especially Yi and Tristana.

and yet riot takes all the strengths from ap yi and ap trist and gave it to their ad builds after the reworks.

Both yi and trist had to be nerfed a lot post rework because of this. (yi more than trist tho)
Trist didn't get nerfed at all post-rework. She has literally only been buffed since her rework came out. She still needs more.

> [{quoted}](name=Thryale,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=36xpxp2h,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2015-05-11T21:45:19.669+0000)
>
> and yet riot takes all the strengths from ap yi and ap trist and gave it to their ad builds after the reworks.
> 
> Both yi and trist had to be nerfed a lot post rework because of this. (yi more than trist tho)

You're kidding yourself, or you actually never played against an AP Yi or AP trist mid.

They absolutely 100% do not have the oppressive strength that they used to.

AP Yi in particular was the least fun lane in the game. Unless he was out of position and you had a bunch of hard CC, he wasn't going to die and he was going to poke you down.

you grossly over estimate how strong ap yi was. I played a lot of ap yi and ap trist. They were strong, but not without their flaws. They were mostly one trick ponies with no fallback patterns if they fell behind.

the cd on ap yi's Q is extremely long early game, and when it gets to a manageable length come mid/late game it's far too risky to use as "poke" due to him landing on top of his target. Sure, you could cheese his Q by targeting a dying minion, but that is not always possible and not exactly the easiest thing to pull off in the tense dance that precedes team fights.

Also, "Unless he was out of position and you had a bunch of hard CC, he wasn't going to die and he was going to poke you down." is the whole point of **learning how to play this game.** If you don't have any solid hard cc, then that's your fault, not the ap yi's fault for exploiting it. If the ap yi has great positioning then he should be rewarded for that, just like any other champ.

Also, ad yi **did** have the oppressive strength of ap yi right after his rework. He was utterly destroying low elo because no one could handle him. It took riot a series of at least 3 nerfs in a row to bring him into a decent spot.

I will admit I was mistaken about trist, I coulda sworn I saw some kind of nerf for her. My bad.

> [{quoted}](name=Thryale,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=36xpxp2h,comment-id=00010001000000010000,timestamp=2015-05-12T02:38:39.699+0000)
>
> you grossly over estimate how strong ap yi was. I played a lot of ap yi and ap trist. They were strong, but not without their flaws. They were mostly one trick ponies with no fallback patterns if they fell behind.
> 
> the cd on ap yi's Q is extremely long early game, and when it gets to a manageable length come mid/late game it's far too risky to use as "poke" due to him landing on top of his target. Sure, you could cheese his Q by targeting a dying minion, but that is not always possible and not exactly the easiest thing to pull off in the tense dance that precedes team fights.
> 
> Also, "Unless he was out of position and you had a bunch of hard CC, he wasn't going to die and he was going to poke you down." is the whole point of **learning how to play this game.** If you don't have any solid hard cc, then that's your fault, not the ap yi's fault for exploiting it. If the ap yi has great positioning then he should be rewarded for that, just like any other champ.
> 
> Also, ad yi **did** have the oppressive strength of ap yi right after his rework. He was utterly destroying low elo because no one could handle him. It took riot a series of at least 3 nerfs in a row to bring him into a decent spot.
> 
> I will admit I was mistaken about trist, I coulda sworn I saw some kind of nerf for her. My bad.

Unavoidable damage without recourse plus absurdly powerful sustain is what made Yi OP in lane. Please reread the part of my post where I said "mid" and "least fun lane".

That is not the whole point of learning to play this game. Avoiding abilities surely is, but do you know how far Alpha Strike can target you from with a good minion to use it on? The required positioning to avoid getting hit was beyond farming reach. If you tried to push him under his turret (best course of action), he could clear nearly all of the minions under the turret due to the strength of his Q + his base AD. Also, not just a lack of CC. A lack of CC that you can afford to save until Yi uses his heal and is instant or near instant. It needs to interrupt channels, which many midlaners do not have easy access to. If it is not quick enough, he will have regained half of the total health which was an absurd amount.

{{champion:84}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:43}} {{champion:143}} (old {{champion:26}} ) {{champion:91}} {{champion:105}}  For reference, if I missed any point them out.

Effectively, what AP Yi did, was turn a lane into "I've already won" and it was absurdly frustrating to play against while also being able to clean up teamfights handily. 

It deserved the neutering it got.

pushing the wave to yi's tower is never a good idea, it leaves you over extended and gives him easy farm. The best way to handle ap yi was to freeze your lane just outside of your own tower, that way you are protected from dives, and if you picked a champ with good wave clear, you can use that to cancel out his shoving if he tries to do so.

Also, so what if some champs didn't do well against yi? Every champ has their matchups. Also, you don't have to kill your opponent and shove down their tower to win your lane. It's better to focus on trying to out farm your opponent and roaming only when you are presented a good opportunity.

AP yi wasn't 'guaranteed' to win his lane just because he had "unavoidable" dmg. It just made winning his lane against stupid opponents that much easier. I've lost my lane as ap yi several times because my opponents were smart and let me shove up exposing myself to ganks and being unable to capitalize on the harass I got on them due to their tower.

Also, katarina was always a great pick into ap yi. She could farm with her BB's if disadvantaged, and her ult was great for stopping his heal before he got any sizable ap. Also, yi had really no way of beating her in trades unless he could get away to heal up. If kat focused on out farming yi, she'd be able t burst him down while his heal is on cd. (22 sec cd is an eternity against a kat)

Old talon was also an excellent counter against ap yi too because of his silence. Once talon got the ad he needed to wave clear, there's really nothing ap yi can do against him.

Yes, ap yi has a strong laning phase, but he doesn't have many options if his opponent engages on him. He's got 1 alpha strike and his weak sauce aa's. AP yi's late game is entirely reliant on resets, and if you deny him that, all that advantage he got in the laning phase goes out the window.

You need to stop looking at things in pieces and look at the big picture. You can't just ignore the flaws in a champ simply because they are really good at a specific time under specific conditions. You need to look at things more holistically. Was ap yi's laning phase frustrating? To champs that specialized in trading and kill potential, yes, to others that specialized in farming, not really. Was ap yi an unstoppable monster? If he got his resets, maybe, but otherwise was just an annoying lane bully with little late game presence.

Also, if you see that the enemy picks yi with top and jungle already taken and you havent picked a mid laner, don't pick a mid laner that is weak against his harass, pick a sustain monster or a farm centered champ that can bring more value to team fights than yi does.

There are numerous ways to deal with any situation presented to you, and it doesn't have always be "dodge the skill shot." tbh, I sorely miss the days when the best advice for how to deal with a champ wasn't "dodge" but rather "group up, focus him" or "stay behind your tank line" or "stun lock him" or "spread out so they can't get the most from their abilities" But I guess that's just me being a season 1 fogey who laments how the game has become more about how good you are at dodge ball than actual strategy.

EDIT: also, to be clear, I've had less fun playing against a le blanc than I ever did playing against an ap yi.

I'm sorry but as a Season 1 player as well, AP Yi was always worse to face than LeBlanc. The idea behind league is that you should not need to pick specific champions to beat one champion. Granted there will and should always been champions that are just better than others at certain things, but beating AP Yi MEANT that you needed Talon, or Pre-Rework Soraka (ftw, this is what I used) or Fizz. 

I don't think Katarina was ever a good counter because he had better poke, her poke was and still is one of the weakest without a full rotation. Also, her grievous wounds is only her on ultimate, and if she ults to prevent his heal, he's still not taking damage with +100 Armor and MR.

Whenever I played against an AP Yi, (hated when he was a last pick in ranked....), I would instantly sigh. I can handle LeBlanc with proper wave clearing and distancing. Yi could wave clear and could stand in your face and take harass because he would just heal it back. His Q CD may have been high, but it also had high base damage for a lvl 1 ability and he could proc his double auto off on you (which at lvl 1 still hurts).

BUT, the #1 thing that I HATED about AP Yi, is that he only needed 1 of your teammates to die........and then the fight was over. Katarina at the time had the same issue, but lacked sustain. The difference is vast in that regard because yi could nuke, heal, get an assist, and then nuke and then stay in his stasis like heal tanking damage unless there was hard CC. On a team with someone like Tryndamere, it was a guaranteed lost teamfight. You can't hold hard CC for both of them. Whereas Katarina relied entirely on E W Q R while only receiving 15% reduced damage for a couple of seconds.

katarina is also targettable while getting resets to try to pentakill the enemy team, AP yi wasn't :(

at a time when supports had boots and wards for items, a 400 base 100% scaling lich bane applying nuke was pretty good at making at least one person die in the fight

> [{quoted}](name=Thryale,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=36xpxp2h,comment-id=0001000100000001000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-12T04:29:12.161+0000)
>
> pushing the wave to yi's tower is never a good idea, it leaves you over extended and gives him easy farm. The best way to handle ap yi was to freeze your lane just outside of your own tower, that way you are protected from dives, and if you picked a champ with good wave clear, you can use that to cancel out his shoving if he tries to do so.

Also, yi had really no way of beating her in trades unless he could get away to heal up. If kat focused on out farming yi, she'd be able t burst him down while his heal is on cd. (22 sec cd is an eternity against a kat)

> 
> You need to stop looking at things in pieces and look at the big picture. You can't just ignore the flaws in a champ simply because they are really good at a specific time under specific conditions. You need to look at things more holistically. Was ap yi's laning phase frustrating? To champs that specialized in trading and kill potential, yes, to others that specialized in farming, not really. Was ap yi an unstoppable monster? If he got his resets, maybe, but otherwise was just an annoying lane bully with little late game presence.
> 
> Also, if you see that the enemy picks yi with top and jungle already taken and you havent picked a mid laner, don't pick a mid laner that is weak against his harass, pick a sustain monster or a farm centered champ that can bring more value to team fights than yi does.

> 
> EDIT: also, to be clear, I've had less fun playing against a le blanc than I ever did playing against an ap yi.

ITT: Clueless Bronzie tries to argue that AP Yi was fair
if a personal insult is the best you can come up with, then it's clear I won the debate and we need not continue this any further.

> [{quoted}](name=Thryale,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=36xpxp2h,comment-id=000100010000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-12T13:33:40.773+0000)
>
> if a personal insult is the best you can come up with, then it's clear I won the debate and we need not continue this any further.

I already came up with a lot more, you just dismissed it as being just how AP Yi was supposed to be.

I still haven't forgiven riot for allowing AP Yi to even exist... 400 base damage 100% AP scaliing untargettable AOE nuke that resets on kill, and applies lich bane... it was like a katarina that would be untargettable during death lotus, and riot said that they liked that playstyle during one of their patch rundowns back then ^^;

"you grossly over estimate how strong ap yi was" 
http://www.funnyjunk.com/channel/lol-channel/Holy+master+yi/nysaGal
Coulda just made them less unfun without making them impossible.  Not like nerfing their AP ratios or something would have ANY effect on their AD builds.

> [{quoted}](name=LifeCyclesTWA,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=36xpxp2h,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-05-11T19:49:15.389+0000)
>
> They killed AP Tristana, AP Yi, AD TF, AP Sion, everything-that-isn't-support Alistar, etc....
> 
> I don't think they will ever care about off-builds unfortunately. In fact, I believe they are strongly against off-builds and will do everything in their power to remove the existence of them.

Mid {{champion:37}} 

Never forget.

Go AD-Assassin Alistar.  Build him straight ADC and jump the enemy squishies with your combo.

Have fun.
sonuds awful

90 AD boost on ult and 70% damage reduction.

Just hope they don't have true damage.

You're not going to get the gold for an ADC without the enemy jungler tearing you a new one.

If he's playing j4, Vi, or gragas, or any early game damage dealer, you are fucked.

They'd still all require you to push out. Farm safe, farm easy, since your trample helps you to farm a lot better under your turret and your E gives you the sustain to stay in the game.  Just start Doran's Ring and go AD from there.
It's still good I've played it in plat. Only downside is no wavclear which sona never had but she has strong laning otherwise

ap tris still works, 4hits on the E and then W+ult in for 3.1apratio burst.
She's just not a no-brainer anymore and offers some counterplay.

which means there is no point in playing her ap.

off builds have always been holistically weaker than their main builds, but have usually excelled in 1 aspect, which when leveraged correctly, offered some kind of advantage that isn't normally present in the normal build

AP ez has his burst and ult

ap trist had her reliability

ap yi had his resets and heal

ap tryn has his god-like sustain

There is usually a reason off builds aren't main builds, but they usually have something "op" to make up for the rest of the kit being lack luster.

AP Trist had her ungodly burst* 

Fixed. She had a 2.0 ration on her R. DFG+R could kill squishies and DFG+E+R killed tanks. :P
Don't recall her ever having a 2.0 AP ratio on her ult. 1.5 AP ratio is still absurdly high.
The thing about ap mf is that she isn't toxic or annoying. She is just good. She isn't a lane bully, and she doesn't have any cheesy heals/spells.

Then they need to buff AD MF or rework her scalings, because she is a mess right now

They didn't even give her a Texture Update. It's like they forgot about her.

>everything-that-isn't-support Alistar,

Everything that isn't support, for every support ever.

Tbf, they did have good reasons for it before, but when Annie and Vel'Koz are dominating... it's for a reason.
Oh how I wish they had nerfed solo lane {{champion:117}} but no, they had to hurt support Lulu instead.
AP Taric {{item:3070}} {{champion:44}} {{item:3070}}
rip full penetration taric

AP trist was a gimmick, AP Yi was viable because of how absurd his ratios were when a champion only needs one damage spell and can mop up teams as well as Kat it is a problem, AP sion only had 2 skills that went well with ap and could dominate same problem as yi, AD TF was also a gimmick he never has really done well as ad because of his really bad attack range.

Voyboy's AD TF says hi.

But I agree with what you said.
That could mean Riot actually remembers off-builds are a thing.

Honestly, I'd prefer focusing her more in a hybrid diretion. 
We lack champions that actually can viably go hybrid, even jax kayle and akali rarly go the hybrid route anymoe.
MF would have the potenital to become a true ranged hybrid carry wiht some changes(and some buffs to the poor hybrid items)

They've generally tried to stay away from hybrids due to the fact that hybrid damage is hard to itemize defense against. And if there were better options of hybrid defense, why bother building one side of defense?

hybrid scaleing and hybrid damage aren't the same.
Corki for example already does 50/50 damage with an ad-built.
Miss fortunes ult deals more magical than physical damage if you go ad, kog also deals nearly 50% magic damage if built ad,
And early on, HP is the best option for tankiness anyway, which counters magic and pshysic, and for later in the game you need a mix of armor and mr anyway as theres rarly a pure ad comp.
The funny thing is that seeing Mage Fortune people buy magic resist... then you just use your ult and laugh and laugh...{{champion:115}}
Haha, that is one benefit of having an ability that scales off of ap but does physical damage!
Someone must really hate Mage Fortune to downvote the entire thread O_O

>The problem with her currently is that her W scales off of AD and does magic damage while her R scales off of AP and does physical damage. Late game this means your ult doesn't scale well with MPen because the W magic damage is minimal.

Can't you build {{item:3035}} ? Granted, it doesn't give AP, but it'd be a decent substitute for void staff if you want your ult damage to be up the roof.

If you take {{item:3020}} there and maybe mpen runes, you have more penetration than most carries even have MR and you don't need {{item:3135}}

Then {{item:3071}} will give you that CDR back. The 40 AD should make up for 91 AP in raw damage, plus you gain the armor reduction, which should give you overall more damage.
That's not bad...

That could mean Riot actually remembers off-builds are a thing.

*Cries in a corner remembering {{item:3089}}{{champion:110}} {{item:3089}} * .

doesn't varrus still do 45% max hp with 3 auto's and and then an ability?

>doesn't varrus still do 45% max hp with 3 auto's and and then an ability?

He does but the problem is that AD Varus will generally out damage that with 3 autos and gets a higher attack speed. It's not necessarily bad, it just kind of raises the question of "why bother".

because normals
